Imports

jsutils, domutils

Types

QuillDom = ref object
  ## The element you created quill onto. [Author: External]
  ## The base element of your quill. 
  ## The wrapper element of your qBase. 
  ## The textarea the lets you edit the contents of a quill.
  ## The body of a quill, with the displayed text.

proc height=(qd: var QuillDom; v: cstring) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc mountTo(qd: QuillDom; base: Element; append = true) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Add QuillDom to element base. If append is false it replaces the current content of base. 
proc newQuillBase(): Element {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Generate the base element of the quill dom. 
proc newQuillBody(): Element {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Create new quill display body. This is where the actual styles are applied. 
proc newQuillDom(height: cstring = ""; readonly = false): QuillDom {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Create a new quill dom object and create the elements. 
proc newQuillWrapper(base: Element; height: cstring = ""): Element {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Generate the wrapper element of the quill dom. Height local to this quill may be specified as a css height format. Global height can be set with a css variable. Height "" means to use global.
